content: Senators ask Gen. Patraeus to define Afghanistan goals Pakistan's commitment questioned in Senate hearing WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Days after President Obama announced his strategy for security in Afghanistan, senior Defense Department leaders told a congressional panel more effort is needed to fight the growing insurgency in Pakistan and Afghanistan. "Considerable further work is required," Petraeus said. "We need to provide the support and assistance to the Pakistani military that will enable them to confront the extremists." He said there is no doubt the United States will see more casualties and costs. "This is going to get harder before it gets easier," the general said, echoing the words of Vice President Joe Biden. "That is our assessment, and it is worth seeing this through to conclusion." Flournoy added, "There will be higher human costs and higher financial costs to this effort."
